page.title: 04Village life in Ousden
page.content: The people of Ousden have a certain affection for their small village, and many expressed a hope that they would remain there always. There is a general feeling of satisfaction and contentment with village life, the people enjoying their homes, gardens, children and their several pets. Most join in the village activities to some degree. Owing to the small size of the community these are somewhat limited and it is necessary for the people to travel to the larger villages and towns for entertainment and services, these include playgroups, youth clubs and day club for the elderly. There is a Womens Institute but it is only supported by a few. The Community Council is elected by the members and the Committee is responsible for some modest events. Some residents wish there was more of a social life.
